summary: Core React page with heading and interactive Yes/No buttons is implemented with warm gradient and playful typography, but several spec details are missing/mismatched (output area visibility, required image name/path) and extra unrequested auth/backend/footer scaffolding was added.

missing_requirements.requirement: An initially-empty output area below the buttons is visible on initial page load (even before clicking Yes).
missing_requirements.reason: The output section is only conditionally rendered when `showOutput` is true, so there is no visible (empty) output area on initial load.

missing_requirements.requirement: On click, display the image asset named exactly “happy_propose_day.jpg” (alt text “Happy Propose Day”) in the output area.
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references `/assets/generated/happy_propose_day.dim_1200x800.jpg` instead of an asset named exactly `happy_propose_day.jpg`.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the required static image asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and reference it via its public URL path (no backend fetching).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary shows no added file under `frontend/public/assets/generated` (only code/CSS/config additions). Also the referenced filename does not match the required `happy_propose_day.jpg`.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication context/provider and related hooks (authentication non-goal).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly lists user accounts/authentication (including Internet Identity) as a non-goal, but auth hooks/providers were added and wired into the app.
Not requested for a simple frontend-only single-page interaction; added infrastructure beyond requirements.
Request/constraints indicate frontend-only unless backend becomes necessary; an empty backend actor was added without a described need.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer with copyright and external link to caffeine.ai.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested in layout/design requirements; introduces extra content beyond the specified single-page layout elements.
